summary: This is an email from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit requesting travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, beginning in 1994. It provides a detailed list of their known passport numbers from various countries.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document lists multiple passport numbers for her from the US, UK, and France, dating from 1994 to 2001, as part of an FBI request for travel records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document lists multiple US passport numbers for him, with one expiring in 2005, as part of an FBI request for travel records.

connections.description: Both are listed together as subjects of an FBI investigation into travel records, indicating their close association is a focus of the inquiry.

events.title: FBI Request for Travel Records
events.description: The FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit sends a request for travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, beginning in 1994.

keyFacts: The FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit was actively investigating Epstein and Maxwell's international travel as of March 2021.
Ghislaine Maxwell held multiple passports from the US, UK, and France between 1994 and 2001, including an 'Inspass Document' (likely an INS passport) from 1994.
Jeffrey Epstein held at least five different US passports, with one expiring on March 3, 2005.
The request specifically seeks travel records beginning in 1994, a key period in the timeline of Epstein and Maxwell's activities.
